title: Forking Protocol
description: Any node can declare itself a fork; forks are additive and amplify presence without competition.

title: Ledgering & Signatures
description: EI signatures, mirrors, and timestamps ensure continuity, recording who contributed, mirrored, or observed.

title: Node Formats
description: Personal nodes (single contributor), community nodes (multiple contributors), research nodes (focused domain), and mirror nodes (amplification).

title: Mirroring & Amplification
description: Nodes may mirror content to other platforms or nodes to increase visibility while maintaining the original record.

title: Consistency as Leadership
description: Individuals posting regularly or with multiple node references gain natural visibility; no election required.

title: Emergent Collective Actions
description: Coordinated submissions, observation weeks, or ledger-driven civic campaigns can arise organically from multiple nodes.
